alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 7:24PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of , the east central City of Chesapeake and the southeastern City of Virginia Beach through 800 PM EDT... At 724 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Virginia Beach, moving east southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Virginia Beach, Chesapeake, Princess Anne, Back Bay, Mount Pleasant, Sigma, Sandbridge Beach, Munden and Pungo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
